text: Tupua Tamasese Mea'ole (3 June 1905 – 5 April 1963) was a Western Samoan paramount chief. He held the royal title of Tupua Tamasese from 1929 to 1963, and O le Ao o le Malo (Head of State) with Malietoa Tanumafili II from 1962 until his death the following year.Tamasese: Architect of West Samoan Independence Pacific Islands Monthly, May 1963, pp41–47 ==References== Category:1905 births Category:O le Ao o le Malo of Samoa Category:1963 deaths
title: Tupua Tamasese Meaʻole
